pages.title: Page 2
pages.content:
November.2017
ADDAC305 Assembly Guide
ADDAC SYSTEM 	page 2
Parts included in the kit:
1x Front Panel
1x Pcb
3x 10uF SMD Capacitors
4x 100nF SMD Capacitors
8x 1k SMD Resistors
8x 470R SMD Resistors
1x 78M05 IC
2x 10mm female/female spacer
4x M3 fiber washer
6x M3 screws
3x Nutted Jacks
9x No-nut Jacks
3x Jack nuts
8x Push Buttons
1x 2x5 IDC Connector
1x Ribbon cable

-- 1 of 1 --

pages.title: Page 3
pages.content:
ADDAC305 Assembly Guide
ADDAC SYSTEM 	page 3
STEP 1:
Locate Pcb and surface mount parts.
STEP 2:
Start by adding a bit of solder to every smd part right pads, this will make it easier to solder the surface
mount parts. If you’re left handed then add solder to the left pads.

-- 1 of 1 --

pages.title: Page 4
pages.content:
ADDAC SYSTEM 	page 4
STEP 3:
Now let’s place all 8 of the 1k resistors, use a tweezer and solder the right pad of each by heating the
already added solder and place the part in place.
STEP 4:
Next solder the right pad for all four 100nF capacitors.
ADDAC305 Assembly Guide

-- 1 of 1 --

pages.title: Page 5
pages.content:
ADDAC SYSTEM 	page 5
STEP 5:
Repeat the process for the eight 470R resistors.
STEP 6:
Finally rotate the pcb 180 degrees and solder all left pads of all smd parts.
ADDAC305 Assembly Guide

-- 1 of 1 --

pages.title: Page 6
pages.content:
ADDAC SYSTEM 	page 6
STEP 7:
Place and solder the 78M05 IC.
STEP 8:
Next place and solder the three 10uF capacitors.
ADDAC305 Assembly Guide

-- 1 of 1 --

pages.title: Page 7
pages.content:
STEP 9:
Place and solder the IDC power connnector, note that the indent faces down.
ADDAC SYSTEM 	page 7
STEP 10:
Next place the spacers adding a fiber washer between the pcb and the spacer.
ADDAC305 Assembly Guide

-- 1 of 1 --

pages.title: Page 8
pages.content:
STEP 12:
Locate and place, do not solder, the 3 jacks with threaded shaft at the bottom.
We’ll now populate all front panel parts:
DO NOT SOLDER ANY PART UNTIL ALL PARTS ARE PLACED!
ADDAC SYSTEM 	page 8
STEP 13:
Place the remaining jacks.
STEP 11:
Locate the jacks and cut the smallest legs like shown below.
ADDAC305 Assembly Guide

-- 1 of 1 --

pages.title: Page 9
pages.content:
ADDAC SYSTEM 	page 9
STEP 14:
Next let’s place latch buttons, note that the buttons have polarity because of the leds inside, longer leg
is the positive (+) side. The bottom of the button also shows + & - markings to show the polarity.
Place these matching the button’s polarity to the markings printed on the pcb.
STEP 15:
Next let’s place the front panel, use a tweezer to help getting all the jacks in their holes.
STEP 16:
Tighten the 3 jack nuts and the 2 screws.
ADDAC305 Assembly Guide
+
+
-
-

-- 1 of 1 --

pages.title: Page 10
pages.content:
ADDAC SYSTEM 	page 10
We’ll now describe s a good practice that minimizes any damage that may occur to all
front panel parts for continued exposure to the soldering iron heat.
It happens often that users not very used to soldering spend too much time on each pad.
An experienced solderer will take 1-2 seconds for each pad, this minimizes the heat the
part is exposed to.
If the solderer takes too much time on each pad the part may heat to a point where the
plastic will start melting/deforming and may render the part useless.
We’ll exemplify the process with jacks.
Step 1 : Start by soldering only one pad of each jack first.
Step 2 : Then solder a second pad of each jack.
Step 3 : Finally solder the remaining pads of all jacks.
Respecting this very simple process for all parts will guarantee no part will be
damaged as they’ll have time to cool down between every soldered pad.
ADDAC305 Assembly Guide

-- 1 of 1 --

pages.title: Page 11
pages.content:
ADDAC SYSTEM 	page 11
STEP 17:
After all parts are placed we’ll now solder all pads.
Follow the process described in the previous page.
STEP 18:
Once finished it will look like this.
Congratulations, you’re done!
ADDAC305 Assembly Guide
